website_summaries.verdict: The Super Badass pedal is a versatile products that offers a dirty and crunchy effect for decades of analog distortion.
pros: Able to get any tone of distortion from any genre
Super EQ control for bass, mid, and treble for precise sound sculpting

customer_reviews.title: Super great pedal without spending a fortune. I really do. Try it, you will not regret.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best distortion pedals that you can buy for less than they cost other pedals. Want a good recommendation: Buy this pedal with closed eyes, your ears, your wallet and your sound will thank you. If you can not spend more than $ 100, this is an excellent investment and choice. This pedal is in my pedalboard for years !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The three potentiometers to equalize give a variety of very useful and nice sound possibilities. From an overdrive, passing a Rockera distortion, to reach some metalheads shades ... just try it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Percak Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Wait a minute...
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t care for the sound at first. Has a good rock tone but prefer my tubescreamer tone. I plugged in again a few days later. It does a great job of clipping tube amp at bedroom volumes for practice. It’s also quieter than tubescreamer as the individual controls allow you to dial in a tone you prefer and keep him to a minimum. The volume on this thing is freaking ear splitting. Great activate during a solo. Will cut through the band with ease. Keeping this along with Boss OD1 and tubescreamer. All have a place and a use on pedalboard
customer_reviews.author: Stratcat

customer_reviews.title: Good Distortion Pedal
customer_reviews.text: Needed a cranked Marshall Plexi sound to cover an early Van Halen song. My Mesa Mark IV, even with EL 34s, does not provide this sound. The MXR M75 into the clean channel provides the required hot distortion and articulation without the muddy lows. The tone controls while limited were adequate at shaping the sound for the mix as needed. The pedal appears to be adequate quality for a around $100. Knobs are tight and the pedal has some weight. This is a a good choice for a hot Marshall distortion sound.
customer_reviews.author: Poly Nomial

customer_reviews.title: Volume knob too sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: Volume goes from a sick cat meow at 1, to a 4x12-100W Marshall at 2. Impossible to find a satisfactory tone with without a huge bump in volume. If you don't mind this, it sounds like a 300 bucks pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Rolo

customer_reviews.title: This pedal is amazing. It preforms as a excellent overdrive in low ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had many distortion/overdrive pedals, before this my BD-2 Blues Driver was my go-to for distortion/overdrive. This pedal is amazing. It preforms as a excellent overdrive in low gain, and is one of the best "non metal" high gain petals i have heard. you can definitely play metal with this, however i would not call it a metal petal. it has become my go-to for any distortion/overdrive.
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected from MXR. Total .DORT” CRUNCH TILL YA DROP!, awesome !!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas. Sundich

customer_reviews.title: It's not just a clever name!
customer_reviews.text: This pedal is solid..Produces some of the most heavy distortion I have heard...Has a lot of gain..Well built and a great addition to any pedalboard!

customer_reviews.text: Really liked this pedal. Extremely versatile, you can configur as a boost, OD, Rock distortion or even a bit heavy metal sound (not Metal Zone level but decent metal disto) Definitely recommend it if you are looking for a jack of all trades kind of distortion
customer_reviews.author: Pedro E Nava Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: The distortion pedal has a great grungy sound and produces a wide range of distortion
customer_reviews.text: The distortion pedal has a great grungy sound and produces a wide range of distortion. Using this pedal was easy and simple to figure out. The sound the distortion pedal produced is loud and clear.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and extremely versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably versatile. From crunchy blues to heavy metal. It really shines in the distortion department and for the price you can't go wrong. After all, distortion pedals are a basic product for any serious guitar player.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: There is no workable volume control. At 0.1 it’s loud. At 0.2 it’s too loud. Anyone out there want mine?
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and great build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great pedal considering it's price. Distortion is usable throughout it's range and the equalizer controls shapes the tone nicely. The character of the distortion is what I would call "tight" - noticeable compression and sustain but without the squeeling that some pedals (like the Boss DS) has. Very versatile with some pop/rock sounds in the first half of available distortion and moving on to some metal and heavier stuff in the second half. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ewert Genis

customer_reviews.title: Super Badass Distortion! Enough said!
customer_reviews.text: Great distortion pedal. One of the 10 best for sure. Bass, Mids, and treble dials, output and distortion controls allow you to really dial in different sounds. Covers a nice range from vintage OD to deep down rock, or even scooped mids metal crunch. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and versatile pedal
customer_reviews.text: The most versatile distortion I've ever used. It goes from a hard-clipping boost to a brutal metal distortion, with endless shaping options available. The analog tone and harmonics are incredible, and the pedal is very quiet. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Badass!
customer_reviews.text: This pedal lives up to its name. Sturdy construction, beautiful to look at, and tons and tons of great tones. Valve tones in a little metal box.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: From Classic Rock to Metal.
customer_reviews.text: Great sounds out of this and it's well built to boot. As easily tweakable as any pedal I own. Fantastic sounding!

customer_reviews.title: It's good but not my kind of sound
customer_reviews.text: It's good but not my kind of sound. For me, this have little intensity and wide coverage but little cheap sound. Anyway it's my opinion after all and I have low quality ear =_=3

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Best distortion pedal I've tried! I practice in the bedroom so I leave the output at around 9:00. Buy one!

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding distortion pedal!
customer_reviews.text: Nice distortion pedal. Very adjustable, and great solid metal construction.

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: I love the rich quality of the rock sound. Well worth my money especially for a newbie guitar player.
customer_reviews.author: Athenax

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I have 25+ years pro. experience and this nails the modded Marshall thing with gain and volume to spare. Anything from boost, moderate drive, alternative, hard rock, old school metal, this thing does it! Probably won't get you in nu-metal territory though it's close. I've owed just about every dirt box including boutiques, this thing is a real winner. Very quiet and very flexible EQ. Works well with combos and stacks. It's a keeper. Buy one! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW H.

customer_reviews.title: Great distortion
customer_reviews.text: Solid distortion. You can really find a wide range of sounds by pushing the low / mid / high EQ up or down further than you think you should. Well made -- feels very well finished. Super Badass.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best sounding distortion I could have asked for
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical because of the cheap price. Wow! Hands down the best sounding distortion I could have asked for. If you are looking for an all around pedal to produce fat, rich, warm, screaming, you name it sounds, this is it. Excellent eq built in.
customer_reviews.author: ChowderChad

customer_reviews.title: Really versatile ÉQ and Nice rich sound
customer_reviews.text: Received it today,.. Really versatile ÉQ and Nice rich sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What's in a name really??  In this case... the truth.
customer_reviews.text: Ok... I understand the name because this things really lives up to it!! Super tight & clean blues / rock tones on the lower end of the gain spectrum... and full on hard rock to crunch metal even when gain is set on the high end... but it stays tight even when maxed! I'm running it through a Peavey 112 VK, 1st gen combo tube amp and this thing blows the stock lead channels away in my opinion because I can shape my tone to drive mids and lows that I just couldn't get with the amp alone before! The cables that came with this package are also pretty nice too.
customer_reviews.author: ChazinPA

customer_reviews.title: 6 out of 5.
customer_reviews.text: from guns and roses to amon amarth this pedal is awesome. rock to death metal. never buying another distortion pedal again.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal.
customer_reviews.text: The eq's on this pedal are surprisingly effective. Can get a whole range of tones as a result. Great pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: Its a Dunlop!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best Dist stompbox I have ever used
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Aquique

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great range of any distortion sound. Really what I was searching for!
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: The name says it all!
customer_reviews.text: The name says it all! I do alot of direct recording and this unit has brought back the edge to my guitar sound. It can go from a light vintage overdrive to super crunch and make it all sound great. I was using the drive on my POD 2.0, but it lacked the harmonic response I needed to get that warm yet crisp tube sound. With the mxr sba distortion in front of the POD, I was able to achieve it. With a little patience and some tweaking, this unit helped me get past a huge roadblock.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Drennen

customer_reviews.title: Not 1/2 @55 Bad
customer_reviews.text: It is not 1/2 @55 Bad but is the sound most guitarist were looking for all these years and now we have it. Super yes and not with a saintly or angelic but more with a almost godly overtone. The name fits well but it is so much more

customer_reviews.title: The most versatile distortion out there
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome distortion you can get every tone of distortion for any genre, to hard/classic rock, metal, punk/grunge, etc. is pretty versatile and sound good, not perfect but more than good, i didnt like that it have a muddy sound, but once paired with my Crybaby it gets fixed (dont know why but the Crybaby makes magic with distortions)
customer_reviews.author: Juan Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Badass ? Yup.  Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Tube Screamer which just wasn't cutting it for getting some more crunch. TS worked with with amps which I could use the amp to add to the distortion but put into a clean amp to try to get some distortion occasionally it failed. This SB never fails, push the button and into every amp I've used it makes for a beautiful noizzzze.
customer_reviews.author: KevinTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal
customer_reviews.text: This pedal produces tones that inspires hours of playing. Three band eq as found on this pedal should be standard on all distortion pedals. Clarity, tone, and versatility is what this pedal offers.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Dist. I've used
customer_reviews.text: This is one best Distortion pedals I've used. Better for lead playing than rytham imo. Great harmonic overtones.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Colston

customer_reviews.title: I let my friend borrow it and he doesn't want to give it back!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, yes I'm very impressed, now when I use my other distortion pedals, they just don't compare. Highly recommend adding this to your rig. The Mid control is where it all happens. Turn it to the left and its a metalish tone. Turn it to the right and it goes to a bluesy tone. In the middle it retains the natural sound of the guitar. Its smooth rich sound with loads of sustain. Great job MXR and named appropriately. Its just a great pedal!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cedeno

customer_reviews.title: The Super however, is simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about getting this, bought the 78' Badass and just was not my thing. The Super however, is simply awesome!!! No need telling you how good it sounds, what sounds good to me means nothing to you. But this is Now one of my favorites and will remain in my collection. My fav dirt pedal....Suhr Riot, JHS Rat, Now the MXR Super Badass and MXR Distortion III....
customer_reviews.author: Doug K.

customer_reviews.title: This box is aptly named
customer_reviews.text: Badass. Absolutely Badass. Tone wise you couldn't ask for a better sounding distortion. If you need more gain than what it has on tap then stack a badass modified OD in front of it. Mxr hit it out of the park with this dirt monster. Their custom team has really outdone themselves. 5 stars easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lord of the strings
